byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ALISON SMALE

abstract: Sec of State John Kerry, speaking at Munich Security Conference,  promises to assist European allies in closing off routes migrants are taking to Europe; Kerry also warns Russia against continuing its military efforts to support Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad; comments come after United States has received criticism from European countries about its reluctance to intervene more forcefully in Syrian civil war.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Kerry, the secretary of state, promised on Saturday to help close off the routes migrants are taking to Europe and warned Russia that its military efforts in Syria to support President Bashar al-Assad would ultimately fail.

headline.main: Facing Allies’ Doubt, John Kerry Voices Confidence in Syria Cease-Fire
headline.print_headline: Despite Skeptical Allies, Kerry Insists Syrian Cease-Fire Will Work

snippet: Mr. Kerry, the secretary of state, promised on Saturday to help close off the routes migrants are taking to Europe and warned Russia that its military efforts in Syria to support President Bashar al-Assad would ultimately fail.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
